alright, it has to be said: fighting games are categorically bad.
they're so fucking unenjoyable. they ALL are pure brain poison that punishes you for missing an arbitrary 50 button combo and has the SINGLE WORST character movement of any video game genre. every movement button either completely changes your moves or gets misread. imagine making a non-platformer game where JUMPING SIDE TO SIDE is the most precise way to get around and god help you if you want to attack AND move. 0 people are actually capable of the kind of perfect input required to do anything outside of button-mashing while relying on visual queues. you either spend hours non-stopping practicing perfect inputs to get the timings right or are button-mashing in all but name. no one is actually "good" at fighting games, they've just learned the order of buttons they should hit for whatever one character they've locked themselves into in the game and hit it over-and-over as fast as possible and claim victory/defeat. and that's probably the worst aspect design-wise: it is UNFATHOMABLE to me that an entire genre of game exists where the selling point is the amount and diversity of playable characters, but playing any more than one of them at any point reduces your gameplay to spray-and-pray compare that to racing games, which also have the prime selling point of the amount and diversity of usable vehicles, but the skills associated with each one viably translate out to any other vehicle build. spending time with a certain build obviously makes you better with it, but switching between vehicles isn't *literally certain* to handicap your ability to play at the same level, the way that switching between fighters does in ANY fighting game. and this is a genre-wide problem: mortal kombat, soulcalibur, smash bros, etc. fighting games either have diversity among characters and suffer gameplay wise, or are incentivized to make all characters play similarly. for example, "Alien", from the Alien movie and game franchise, could be the absolute coolest character in any fighting game, but instead in mortal kombat it's just a humanoid bipedal fighter with a tail. they HAD to make it play similarly too other characters for gameplay to be viable, which sacrifices all the coolest potentials of adding a literal xenemorph to the game, while making its moveset as dull are arbitrary as any other, but with cool graphics. it's so fucking frustrating that there's no way to make a fighting game with diverse characters without having the act of playing any character over your "main" completely compromise gameplay. fighting games are just categorically unfixable in terms of game design and balance. not one adult has even a single healthy relationship with another human being and enjoys playing fighting games. but the movement in fighting games holy shit it's so fucking bad. trying to control where your character is in a fighting game is like throwing your shit at an industrial sized fan, while getting hit by the backblast of an RPG, while hanging upside down the best i've ever seen is either Dragonball's flying or SoulCalibur's 3D dodging. any genre where the highest quality games are Dragonball and SoulCalibur doesn't deserve the embarrassment of existing. like FFS fighting in Dragonball is a fucking chore and shouldn't even be considered fighting as much as chasing in circles. and if you play smash you're honestly just a pedophile. straight up. that shit is so fucking weird to me; it's an inconsistent mess of characters from different universes with 0 attempt at game balance that requires hundreds of hours of practice per character to get ANY enjoyment meanwhile it has like what? 50 characters? idek because it's so fucking boring that i'd never waste my time paying it attention. it should be a crime to market it game on its range of characters while having that kind of NECESSARY per-character time-investment like jesus fucking christ, if you actually know the down+b for every smash character i seriously hope you see a therapist, for your own sake and for the sake of the 9 year olds who these games are made for if improving skill at fighting enemies in video games is the enjoyment someone is looking for, dark souls or even batman: arkham night or any spider-man game is infinitely less rage enduring and requires WAYYY less time investment. and that's not to mention games that co-center world exploration like the witcher or assassins creed i'm obviously just raging out over the 1's and 0's i don't like at this point, but i'm actually mind-blown that anyone would spend their time in shitty fighting simulators when they could be playing a game with MORE CONTROL over the fights and other content. like even fucking Watch Dogs is more fun to me, and those games are ass, but at least when i press a button i know what it does and it does it consistently and predictably i cannot imagine coming home and thinking "oh, i know what sounds like fun, trying to win a competition based on my ability to reproduce a 50-button sequence completely from muscle memory" i'd rather just blast my mind with xanax and build a house in minecraft LMAO and for fucks sake playing against a sweat-lord who's put in a thousand hours into one of these fighting games (but hasn't ever played more than two of the 50 characters lol) is objectively worse than human torture. you ALWAYS just end in either a grab/throw spiral or bouncing up and down like a piñata without ANY control of your character whatsoever. HOW IS THAT FUN? even for the sweat-lord cheeto man doing the juggling, HOW IS THAT FUN? god they're repugnant af when i regain control of my emotions i'm gonna look over this thread again and try to psychoanalyze and synthesize the reasons i hate fighting games into a coherent message... might even write a medium article lol last post in this thread is a genuine plea: can someone tell me 1 reason to play a fighting game over a racing game or call of duty zombies or any 2+ player platformer or coop-rpg?

Title: An Exhilarating Journey into the World of Overwatch!

Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)

Overwatch is an absolute masterpiece that has captured my heart and imagination like no other game before. From the moment I dove into its vibrant and diverse world, I was instantly hooked on the adrenaline-pumping action, the rich storytelling, and the unparalleled teamwork that this game offers.

The first thing that struck me about Overwatch was its incredible cast of characters. Each hero is a unique masterpiece, not only in terms of gameplay mechanics but also in terms of personality and design. Whether you're a sharpshooting Widowmaker, a healing and protective Mercy, or a fierce and unyielding Reinhardt, there's a hero that resonates with every type of player. This diverse cast promotes a sense of inclusivity and allows players to find a character that suits their playstyle perfectly.

The attention to detail in the game's world-building is simply astonishing. The maps are intricately designed, ranging from the futuristic cityscapes of Numbani to the ancient beauty of Hanamura. Every corner is filled with lore, making each match feel like a part of a grand narrative. The stunning visuals and the seamless blend of various cultures and aesthetics create a visually captivating experience that's a feast for the eyes.

Overwatch's gameplay is an exhilarating rollercoaster of excitement and strategy. The team-based objective gameplay is both accessible for newcomers and endlessly rewarding for experienced players. Whether you're pushing payloads, capturing points, or engaging in thrilling team battles, the tactical depth and the need for coordinated teamwork keep every match feeling fresh and engaging. The synergy between heroes, the carefully crafted game modes, and the constant updates ensure that the gameplay remains dynamic and engaging, even after countless hours of play.

But what truly sets Overwatch apart is the sense of community and camaraderie it fosters. The game encourages teamwork, communication, and cooperation like no other. I've made lifelong friends through Overwatch, strategizing and celebrating victories together, and learning from defeats. The game's emphasis on teamwork and its positive player interactions create an atmosphere that's welcoming and uplifting, even in the heat of battle.

In conclusion, Overwatch is an absolute triumph that has redefined the world of team-based shooters. Its incredible character roster, immersive world, strategic gameplay, and strong sense of community make it a game that stands head and shoulders above the rest. Whether you're a casual gamer looking for some fun or a competitive player seeking intense challenges, Overwatch offers an experience that's both captivating and endlessly rewarding. So, grab your heroes, rally your team, and embark on an unforgettable journey into the vibrant and thrilling world of Overwatch!

守望先锋不仅是一个游戏，更是2016年的那个盛夏，是一代人再也回不去的韶华。那里阳光明媚，蝉鸣呦呦，希望尚未从指隙四散奔逃，命运也还没有扣下扳机，万物发展欣欣向荣，一切似乎未来可期。
沧海桑田，时过境迁，白驹过隙，光阴似箭，所有对过去的追忆深埋在短短数言里，命运射出的子弹也命中了生活的眉心，沉重而悄然。雨滴落在平静的深潭，绝望的死水泛起涟漪，而我似乎从中听到几句话，朝气蓬勃，掷地有声：
“我们是希望”
“我们是荣耀”
“我们是勇气”
“我们是正义”
“我们是怜悯”
“……”
“……”
“我们是守望先锋”
我们才是守望先锋

Впервые попробовал вторую часть одной из моих самых любимых игр. Спасибо конечно близам за скины ценой в мои месячные траты на жизнь. Но если не брать во внимание все эти нюансы насчет скинов, то у нас вроде бы есть персонаж, дамага от скинов больше не будет, вам дали бесплатную игру с крутым геймплеем, хватит наяривать на скины. Обидно конечно, но что поделать, навернем отборной коричневой массы, проглотим и потерпим, может что-то да когда-нибудь изменится. Могу точно сказать что это просто прекрасная игра, в которой можно посидеть и позалипать вечерками с друзьями. Всё же есть в ней что-то, что цепляет. 
Сейчас добавили прогрессию для персонажей, на мой взгляд это очень интересная штука чтобы остаться в игре на подольше (Люблю статистику и всё что с ней связано). Если нужно получить фан от игры, то она запросто это даст, все динамично, красочно. Если хочется попотеть, то тоже можно устроить, только вот подбор матчей в рейтинге на высоких рангах долговатый, но можно во время поиска и побегать на ДМе.
В общем и целом это достаточно хорошая бесплатная игра, которая может скрасить ваши вечера и подарить кучу положительных эмоций.

I originally started playing on console when this game first came out back in 2016. I switched to PC around Ana's release and played ranked OW (Diamond Support main) nearly everyday until the release of Ash, by which point I started playing other games and wasn't as dedicated to OW. By this point I'd only play during the seasonal/story events. I almost quit playing entirely once OW2 was announced and the devs left OW1 in limbo for three years. I didn't stop playing because I didn't like the game; I still found it fun from time to time. But the extremely toxic community and lack of meaningful content and updates had me looking to other games to scratch my competitive itch.

Overwatch 2 was supposed to revitalize both the game and the community. Blizzard promised us a brand-new expansive PvE experience and a revamped PvP. Instead, we got a half-baked balance update (the only real meaningful change was the removal of one tank role), three new heroes, and a few new maps. What has Blizzard been doing the entire time while they left OW1 to wither and rot? 

Blizzard decided to make OW2 free-to-play and it's just as you would expect it to be: grindy battle passes with sub-par items that no one cares for, an overpriced premium shop to spend $20+ on skins, and a slow drip-feed of content to keep gamers coming back to spend more money. I am *not* a fan of battle passes. I don't want to feel obligated to dedicate hours of my life grinding a game for fear of missing out on items that I payed for. I hate having to do challenges that forces me to play content I never cared to do in the first place; playing roles I don't like, playing game modes I don't want to play. And then there's the shop. I wouldn't mind the shop if the items were reasonably priced, but I'm not paying over $20 for a single skin for a character in a game where swapping heroes mid-match is needed and encouraged. The worst part about this isn't even the pricing, either. It's the fact that you can no longer *earn* the new cosmetics anymore. Say what you will about loot boxes in gaming, Blizzard actually did it right with OW1. You earn loot boxes every time you level up. And if you wanted more loot boxes, you can just buy them. You didn't need to buy boxes if you didn't want to. I never spent a dime on them. Everything I had pre-OW2 I had earned. Now if you want any cosmetics, you *have* to buy them, either through the shop or the battle pass. 

Ranked OW2 is a literal crapshoot. Blizzard decided to hide everyone's SR and now you can't see if you move up or down in ranking. A reasonable person would assume,"I won a match, I must be going up in rank" but no. That's not how it works. You can win 7 matches in a row and when the game decides to update your rank, you'll find yourself in a lower division. The opposite can happen too. You can lose all of your matches and somehow move up. And your placement matches mean nothing. It doesn't matter how high you were in OW1 or how well you performed in your placements. Most players end up somewhere between silver-gold and will have to work their way up to their proper rank. This issue is made even worse by the fact that OW2 is F2P. Now there's an endless stream of smurfs and hackers in the lower divisions. If you're the type to solo-queue, you're going to have to claw your way tooth and nail through teammates below your skill level, GM smurfs, and aimbotters. 

I've never felt so betrayed by a game company before. I've dedicated years of my life to this IP. And what do I get in return? Empty promises and a slap to the face by greedy suits that don't care nor respect the players. They ruined a beloved IP with so much potential just for some quick profit. 

Now the only thing Overwatch is good for is being source material for r34 artists and animators.

Fuck Bobby Kotick and fuck Blizzard.
